bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: United States District Court Western District of Washington Northern Division.
In the matter of the Application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Gwoo Shee Ah Look } No. 2647 Return to amended petition.
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of said Court:
Come now John H. Sargant, Acting Commissioner of Immigration, at Seattle, and for answer to the amended Petition filed herein, states as follows:
-I- That he denies each and every allegation of the amended petition, save and except what is herein specifically admitted.
-II- That he admits that attorneys were not present at the hearing of the above named petitioner, and alleges that the facts are as set forth in the affidavit of J.H. Barbour, hereto annexed.

-III- That the petitioner should be deported as appears from the transcript of the testimony taken at the time of the hearing on the warrant, which transcript is marked No. 3513, In the Matter of Ah Sing, alias Gwoo Shee Ah Look, which transcript is marked exhibit "A", attached hereto, and made a part of this amended return.

Wherefore, said John H. Sargant, prays the above entitled
court dismiss the petition nad amended petition herein.
United States of America Western District of Washington Northern Division } ss.

John H. Sargant being first duly sworn on oath deposes and says: That he is the party named in the foregoing amended return; that he has read the same, knows the contents thereof and verily believes the same to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 29th day of April, 1914.
div1.ab: Ed M Lakin Deputy clerk, U.S. Dist. Court, Western Dist. of Washington

figure.ab: Seal of the United States District Court
